page.title: 07SHOPS IN LOWER WORTLEY LEEDS
page.content: There is a parade of six shops near our school on Lower Wortley Road. These shops provide a service for the surrounding area. The parade consists of a butcher, wool shop, hairdresser, confectioner, estate agent and green grocer. We asked the shopkeepers about their daily routine. The butcher and his wife own the butcher's and hairdresser's and live over the hairdressing salon. They have lived there for 27 years and have seen the area opposite the shop develop from open fields and cottages to rows of modern terraced houses. Their customers all live locally and use the shops regularly. The butcher chooses his own meat from the abattoir and it is then delivered to the shop. He makes his own sausages but buys ready - made pies.
